title: NASA retaining plans to select a single Artemis lunar rover
summary: NASA is not reconsidering plans to select only one company to develop an Artemis lunar rover, despite a setback in another program procuring key elements of the lunar exploration effort as a service.

title: GAO Reports NASA’s Lunar Gateway May Have "Stack Controllability." Issue With Starship
summary: GAO Reports NASA’s Lunar Gateway May Have "Stack Controllability." Issue With Starship

title: Rocket Lab launches fifth Synspective satellite
summary: Rocket Lab launched the fifth radar imaging satellite for Japanese company Synspective Aug. 2, continuing work with its largest commercial customer.

title: SpaceX Announces Dragon Recovery Operations Moving To US West Coast
summary: SpaceX Announces Dragon Recovery Operations Moving To US West Coast

title: NordSpace Announces New Spaceport Canada and $5M Investment
summary: NordSpace Announces New Spaceport Canada and $5M Investment

title: NASA Johnson Dedicates Dorothy Vaughan Center to Women of Apollo
summary: On the eve of the 55th anniversary of the Apollo 11 Moon landing, NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston commemorated the unsung heroes who helped make humanity’s first steps on the Moon possible.  To celebrate their enduring legacy, Johnson named one of its central buildings the “Dorothy Vaughan Center in Honor of the Women of […]

title: Poland, Hungary, and India Join Next Axiom Crew
summary: Axiom Space’s fourth mission aboard SpaceX’s Crew Dragon spacecraft is set to carry astronauts from Poland, Hungary, and India next year, setting the stage for yet another record breaking international segment.

title: U.S. Air Force awards $14.9 million contract to Capella Space for radar imaging
summary: The multi-year contract is to integrate Capella's radar imaging data into a U.S. Air Force Research Lab experimental cloud-based platform

title: KVH Industries leans on maritime connectivity competitor Starlink for growth
summary: Maritime connectivity provider KVH Industries is seeing signs of a turnaround after buying a chunk of satellite capacity from Starlink, SpaceX’s broadband constellation in non-geostationary orbit.

title: Artemis II Core Stage Arrives at Kennedy
summary: Teams transport NASA’s SLS (Space Launch System) core stage into the Vehicle Assembly Building at the agency’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida on July 24, 2024. Tugboats and towing vessels moved the Pegasus barge and 212-foot-long core stage 900-miles to the Florida spaceport from NASA’s Michoud Assembly Facility in New Orleans, where it was manufactured and assembled.
